item.description:
For January's meeting we will be getting together to watch the a collection of short TED talk videos to view and discuss.  TED is short for Technology, Engineering and Design.  These talks are usually less than twenty minutes and are on currently relevant topics to Humanism.

We have currently narrowed down the videos to:

Michael Specter: The danger of science denial
Sam Harris: Science can answer moral questions
Dan Dennett on dangerous memes

and if there is time and interest
Alain de Botton: Atheism 2.0

There will be time for discussion after each talk.  Feel free to bring comfy chairs if you wish.  And remember, it can be cool in the hall, so dress comfortably!
item.name: January Meeting - TED talks viewing and discussion
